text: Hazy yellow pour with a foamy white head. Notes of soapy slightly fruity hops, waxy, grass, and earth.
12 ounce can. Pours a somewhat hazy gold with a nice white head. Aroma of grass, grain, and malt. Taste is grass, grain, malt, floral, and some spice. Nice Pilsener.

Can from Smiths. Pours hazy golden with white head. Nose is crisp hops, pale malt, florals. Tastes pale malty, Saaz hoppy, floral, and I get some herbal notes in this, almost like a white pepper and cilantro flavor.
Pale yellow golden pour from can. Spicier with saaz I guess bitterness. Pretty decent.
Clear golden color with a white head. Aroma is grass, cereal, light bread, some grain, pale malt, lightly fruit. Lighter bodied, high bitterness for the style, very drinkable. Nailed it.

Pours pale gold with a white head. Aromas of grass, hay, mild sewage water. Favor is grasses, grain, light floral, hint of citrus, and pepper.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Can: Light peppery hay nose. Cloudy yellow, medium head, little retention. Fairly rich barley malt, hay. Medium body, moderate carbonation. Flavorful pils.
Draught, Fine golden body with white head. Aroma is pleasant, floral and full. Body seemed thin, with very little flavour. Crisp hop finish. This beer began well, continued badly and ended well
user_location: Munchen an der Willamette, Oregon, USA

text: Aroma is grainy malts and light citrus/fruit. The flavor is grainy malts, citrus/fruit and a mix of spicy hops and slightly tart/smooth in the finish.
Golden color with a medium white head that left nice lacing on the glass. Straw, grains, toast, grass, dry finish.

12oz can. Clear apple juice body with small off-white head. Aroma is medium sweet, spicy, some herbal, apple. Taste is moderately sweet, apple, some spicy, light orange, cereal. Soft light-medium body.

UPDATED: MAY 22, 2017 Can. Almost clear pale gold with a white head. 3+ Aroma of crackers and grain with lemon and light spices. Clean. Sweet pale malt is less grainy than expected from the aroma. Clean with lower bitterness than hoped for, but the finish dries out a bit and its nicely spicy at the end. A bit on the sweet side for me with undistinguished malt character. OK. [next day] Eh, a little colder and the sweetness is more subdued and the nice finish shines a bit more.

Can thanks to Jeremy! Pours clear pale golden with a medium white head, some lacing. Aroma is bready, grains, grass, noble hops. Flavor is light sweet, light plus bitter, bready, a bit floral, grains and noble hops. Pretty classic representation and well done. Light body.

12 oz can purchased at Lukas Liquors in Overland Park, Kansas. Canned 04/07/17 printed on bottom of the can. The pour is a slight chill haze straw yellow golden with a noisy foamy one inch white head. The aroma is clean cracker malt, hay, straw and floral. The taste is grassy, cracker malt, straw, floral, soft herbal and a clean crisp finish. The palate is light to medium bodied, with active carbonation and the mineral malt finish. Clean, crisp and refreshing as advertised. If I can find this fresh, Ill buy a bunch this summer.

Thanks to Chris for this very refreshing offering. Robe claire parsemée de fines bulles lentes. Tête bien construite et persistante. Arômes frais et granuleux desquels émane un houblonnage à leuropéenne. En bouche la céréale occupe une place de premier plan. Presque sûre, celle-ci est savoureuse et subit clairement une lente transformation chimique. Le tout demeure plutôt sec, floral et bien long en bouche. Une épice marque la finale alors que sestompe les froides levures. Très heureux de goûter cette canette qui me parvient de loin.

Draft at City Beer. Clear bright golden yellow with a lacy white head. Aroma is grass, floral notes, bread, bit of wet dog. Flavor is exceedingly clean and crisp, decently hoppy. Light on the feel, a drinkable lawnmower beer if you will.

Can from Sake no Taniguchi. Pours a crystal clear straw gold, half finger of head, leaves good lacing. Spot on simple German pils aroma, spice, grass, grainy malt. Grain forward flavour accentuated by floral hopping and lingering spice. Medium pils feel, restrained bitterness, crisp and dry. Very faithful to style, restrained and wonderfully balanced. Easy drinking. Fortunately I have another in the fridge.
Shared 12 oz. can. Clear pale straw, white head. Aroma of pils malt and grass. Taste is pils malt, grass, grains, a bit of fruitiness. A nice pilsner. Could drink a few of these.

Aroma: lightly malty and spicy; Appearance: clear yellow pour with thin white head that disappears quickly; Taste: follows nose; crisp and grainy; Palate: light bodied with medium finish; Overall: great for a pils.
$2.70 can from Wine Warehouse. Pours pale gold with a white head. Aromas of grass, hay, mild sewage water. Favor is grasses, grain, light floral, hint of citrus, and pepper. Not bad.

On tap at Hops and Pie poured a clear gold with a lasting white head. Aromas of bread, yeast and light fruitiness. Palate was light bodied and smooth with a dry finish. Flavors of bread, yeast and fruitiness with a smooth dry finish.

On tap at Hops & Pie. Pale yellow appearance with a fluffy white head and light lacing. Aroma of toasted malts, spicy hops, light grains and light citrus zest. Similar flavor, crisp, clean, mildly bitter and lightly sweet. Light and crisp with a fluffy mouth feel and a pleasant finish. Easy to drink and smooth as hell. Top notch pils overall.

Clear light golden with a thick foamy white head. Classic pilsner nose of Pilsen malt and German blonde cracker and a thin grassy sunshiney undertone. Crisp dry flavor thats crackery and dry and slightly perfumey, German and Pilsen blonde grainy hay tones and a little Saab grassy pepperiness. Dry and super classical. If you didnt know any better, this would totally be an authentic import from the fatherland.
Draught at Alesmith. Golden color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, hops, toast, grass and malts. Bitter finish with citrus, hops, malts, toast, grass and bread. Good pilsner.
Not sure how this is a Top 50 rated Pilsner other than people see AleSmith. Either ways its decent Im working on a 6 pack, no complaints.

12 oz. can, pours a hazy golden blonde with a small white head. Aroma brings out a herbaceous grassy character upfront, followed by biscuity malt. Flavour follows accordingly, with lots of grassy hops, plenty of herbal character, and biscuity malt. A proper German pils here. Count on AleSmith to get this right. Very good.
Yum. This is a very good and reasonable pilsener. Dry but not over the top. It has a good crispness. Really well done.
had in a can. mild nose, light and clean finish. Very mild bitterness at the end characteristic of a pilsner.
Aroma is grain, a slight fruity hint, herbal. Taste is mainly herbal, some fresh cut grass, a bit of grain. Solid pils.

Can in Seattle. Soft white cream, rich pale gold. Cool honey grain. Good sweet green hop. Lighter bitterness, grassy malt, and plenty of honey sweetness. Clean, balanced bitterness. Delicious but untraditional.

12 ounce can. Pours a clear medium gold color topped by a frothy white head that disappates quickly. Light grainy malt nose. Sweet grainy malt flavor has a hint of creamed corn. Transcends to grassy, floral hops with a slight buttery note. Lacks crispness and depth, but good nonetheless.

12oz can pours a clear pale golden with a medium white head. Aroma of sweet grainy bread malt and light grassy hops. Taste of lightly sweet bready grain malt with corn, with doughy yeast, and grassy lightly bitter hops on the finish. Lacking crispness and dryness, but decent and very drinkable.

Darker golden yellow with white effervescent head.
Nose is grain forward, slightly sweet. Bready.
Crisp body. Flavor is grain heavy at first but opens up with a nice spicy hop bite.
Dialed in.

Can from Wallys in Beverly Hills. Now this is good lager. Perfectly clear gold color with a medium white head. Aroma is light hay, lager yeast and white bread with a crisp bitterness. The flavor is classic pilsner with lightly sweet malt and then earthy hops that finish dryly. Pretty cool to see Alesmiths diversity in brewing and they did a great job here.

(En fût à Bottlecraft Solana Beach): Herbacé, légèrement fromagé, céréalier voire juteux et miellée avec une sécheresse plus quadéquate. Belle addition de légèreté au menu légendairement plus robuste.

Keg @ Belmont Station. Gold pour with a beautifully creamy white head. Aroma of honeycomb. Crisp malt. Light grass. Flavor is a touch sweet. Dry finish. Crackery clean malt. Light honey. Medium body, buoyant carb. Nice .
Tap at AleSmith. Pours clear pale yellow. Aroma and flavor are pilsner malt, floral notes, light citrus, and soft lager yeast esters. Light body.

Draught at the brewery. Pours clear gold with a medium, frothy white head, medium retention with good lacing. Aroma is moderate corny Pils malt, light spicy hops. Flavor is crisp corny Pils malt, light earthy and spicy hops and bitterness with a dry finish. Light body and moderate carbonation.
